# bitset integer

C++ arbitrary-precision integer library using STL bitset.

## How to use

```
bi<128> x(12345); // Initialize a 128-bit integer by int.
bi<128> y("-12345"); // Initialize a 128-bit integer by string.

x += y; // Calculate between bitset integers.

std::cout << x.to_llong() << std::endl; // Conversion to long long int.
std::cout << x.to_string() << std::endl; // Conversion to string.
```

The following operators can be applied to bitset integers.

```
+, -, *, /, %, +=, -=, *=, /=, %=, <, >, <=, >=, ==, !=, =
```

## Is this library fast?

No. I created this library as a hobby and have not optimized it. But it is able to run small algorithms (See some samples below).
